rounds.event: Both a blue moon and a total lunar eclipse occur.
deaths: Rasual Butler, American professional basketball player

rounds.event: World War II: German field marshal Friedrich Paulus surrenders to the Soviets at Stalingrad, followed two days later by the remainder of his Sixth Army, ending one of the war's fiercest battles.
Two Japan Airlines planes nearly collide over Suruga Bay in Japan.
deaths: Gordon R. Dickson, Canadian American author

rounds.event: World War II: The end of fighting in the Battle of Hill 170 during the Burma Campaign, in which the British 3 Commando Brigade repulsed a Japanese counterattack on their positions and precipitated a general retirement from the Arakan Peninsula.
births: Rynn Berry, American historian and author
Brenda Hale, Baroness Hale of Richmond, English lawyer, judge, and academic
Joseph Kosuth, American sculptor and theorist

rounds.event: Anton Chekhov's Three Sisters premieres at Moscow Art Theatre in Russia.
